intro: Nototriche trollii, commonly known as the African ghost orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky outcrops and dry grasslands. The plant is characterized by its unique, pale greenish-yellow flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Nototriche trollii is a small, ephemeral plant that blooms briefly during the dry season, making it a rare and elusive sight in the wild.
